intro: Orthocarpus bracteosus var. albus, commonly known as the white bract orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided foliage and produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels. Its varietal name, *albus*, refers to the pale or white coloration of its bracts and flowers. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
